com.raweng.built.userInterface

Class BuiltUILoginController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.raweng.built.userInterface.BuiltUILoginController

  • public abstract class BuiltUILoginController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides login functionality for built.io.
    Author:
    raw engineering, Inc

    Note :
    User needs to add the following permissions in manifest.

  • Allows access to the list of accounts in the Accounts Service.

  • Allows an application to request authtokens from the AccountManager.

  • Add com.google.android.providers.gsf.permission.READ_GSERVICES permission to allow the API to access Google web-based services.

  • Add <meta-data android:name="com.google.android.gms.version" android:value="@integer/google_play_services_version" />
    in application tag as required for upgraded Google Play services


    • Usage :

    Before using any type of login, the user needs to set the application key. 
     // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 setApplication(builtApplication);
  • The user can open sign-up activity by passing intent.
    •  setSignUpIntent(signUpIntent);
  • For twitter login, the user can set consumer key and consumer secret using setUpTwitter(String, String).

  • Initialize BuiltTwitterLoginActivity in manifest refer Quick Start Documentation.

    •  setUpTwitter("consumerKey","consumerSecret");

    Example
     public class UserActivity extends BuiltUILoginController

 setApplicationKey("blt5d4sample2633b");

      • setACL

        public void setACL(BuiltACL builtACL)
        Sets ACL on this object.
        Parameters:
        builtACL - object of BuiltACL class.
        Note :- For simple built login BuiltACL object gets set while sign up.

        Example
         BuiltACL builtACL = new BuiltACL();
 builtACL.setPublicWriteAccess(true);

 setACL(builtACL);

      • loginSuccess

        public abstract void loginSuccess(BuiltUser user)
        Provides the BuiltUser object after successful Login.
        Parameters:
        user - BuiltUser object
        Example
        @Override
public void loginSuccess(BuiltUser user) {
        
   //User can get Access tokens after success.
        
   String googleAccessToken = user.getGoogleAccessToken();
        
   String twitterAccessToken = user.getTwitterAccessToken();
        
   String twitterAccessTokenSecret = user.getTwitterAccessTokenSecret();
        
}

        Parameters:
        error - BuiltError object
